dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1838 IH: Global Health, Empowerment and Rights Act

McBath, Ms. Underwood, and Ms. Bush) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit the application of certain restrictive eligibility requirements to foreign nongovernmental organizations with respect to the provision of assistance under part I of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Global Health, Empowerment and Rights Act.

section.header: Assistance for foreign nongovernmental organizations under part I of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961
section.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, regulation, or policy, in determining eligibility for assistance authorized under part I of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 (22 U.S.C. 2151 et seq.), foreign nongovernmental organizationsâ€”

paragraph.text: shall not be ineligible for such assistance solely on the basis of health or medical services, including counseling and referral services, provided by such organizations with non-United States Government funds if such services do not violate the laws of the country in which they are being provided; and

shall not be subject to requirements relating to the use of non-United States Government funds for advocacy and lobbying activities other than those that apply to United States nongovernmental organizations receiving assistance under part I of such Act.
